docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21. -- The Director of the Mint in his report upon the production of the precious metals during the calendar year 1867, just submitted to the Secretary of the Treasury, states that the value of the gold produced in the United States...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21. -- The Director of the Mint in his report upon the production of the precious metals during the calendar year 1867, just submitted to the Secretary of the Treasury, states that the value of the gold produced in the United States during the period mentioned was $57,363,000. The South African Republic holds first place, producing gold to the value of $57,633,861, Australasia's production was worth $55,684,182, and Russia mined $23,245,763.

headline.main: WORLD'S GOLD AND SILVER; Statistics for the Year 1897 Furnished by the Director of the Mint. PRODUCTION MUCH INCREASED African Gold Mines in the Lead, Followed Closely by Those of the United States and Australasia.
